snippet: For the second night in a row, more than a dozen cars were lit on fire. There have been no arrests.
abstract: Los Angeles authorities say that, for a second night in a row, more than a dozen cars were set ablaze in Hollywood; say that no arrests have been made but that more than one person has been detained and questioned.

byline.original: By SARAH MASLIN NIR and ELIZABETH A. HARRIS

lead_paragraph: For the second night in a row, more than a dozen cars were lit on fire. There have been no arrests.

headline.seo: Cars Set on Fire in Los Angeles Area for a Second Night
headline.main: For a Second Night, Vehicles Are Set Ablaze in the Los Angeles Area
headline.print_headline: Second Night Of Car Fires In Los Angeles
